event.title: became New York's first capital in 1777

data.event: It became New York's first capital in 1777, and was burned by the British on October 13, 1777, after the Battles of Saratoga.

event.title: was burned by the British on October 13, 1777

data.event: It became New York's first capital in 1777, and was burned by the British on October 13, 1777, after the Battles of Saratoga.
As early as 1614 the Dutch had set up a factorij (trading post) at Ponckhockie, at the junction of the Rondout Creek and the Hudson River.

event.title: came from the area of Rensselaerswyck in 1653

data.event: The first recorded permanent settler in what would become the city of Kingston, was Thomas Chambers, who came from the area of Rensselaerswyck in 1653.
